name: Version Control
description: Here at L2C we use Git and GitHub for our version control. I need you to spend a few days getting up to speed with them.

learning_steps.text: Star the Learn to Cloud Repository
learning_steps.title: Learn to Cloud Repository

learning_steps.text: Set up an AI learning assistant
learning_steps.action: Set up an AI learning assistant
learning_steps.description: AI assistants can help you learn by asking questions and clarifying concepts—but they should never replace your own thinking. In Phase 3, you'll learn how to use these tools effectively. For now, use AI **only** for the specific prompts we provide. The key rule: AI should quiz *you*, not answer *for* you. Set up an account with ChatGPT, Claude, or another AI assistant and try it with this prompt:
learning_steps.code: I'm studying cloud engineering and recently learned about version control. I will provide you an explanation about it and please ask me any questions if my explanation is not clear. I want to make sure I really understand this concept so please do not correct me, simply ask questions until I get the explanation right. Here is my explanation: version control is...

learning_steps.title: Command Line for Beginners – How to Use the Terminal Like a Pro

learning_steps.description: Using a Terminal, create a folder on your computer where you will store all your labs and projects. Name it `l2c`. Use the `mkdir` and `cd` commands for this.

Clone your README repo to your local machine. Use VS Code to edit it and push changes back to GitHub from the terminal. Don't feel like you have to make a very fancy README—write a brief description on who you are and add links to your socials.

secondary_links.text: Great guide on using markdown with VS Code

questions.prompt: How would you explain version control to a junior developer who's never used it, and why is it essential?
scenario_seeds: A new intern just overwrote the production config file and there's no backup—explain how version control would have prevented this
Your team of 5 developers keeps emailing code files back and forth and stepping on each other's changes
A client wants to see what their application looked like 3 months ago before a major feature was added
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain version control as a system for tracking changes over time AND describe collaboration benefits AND explain how rollback/history features prevent data loss.

questions.prompt: Walk me through the basic Git workflow: what happens from staging to pushing changes?
scenario_seeds: You just fixed a bug in three different files and need to save your work and share it with the team
A colleague asks why their changes aren't showing up on GitHub even though they saved the files
You need to explain to a new team member why we don't just edit files directly on GitHub
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain the staging area concept AND describe the commit as a snapshot with a message AND explain pushing to sync with remote repository.

test_knowledge_prompts: Can you ask me what version control is and why it's important?
Can you quiz me on the basic Git commands like clone, commit, push, and pull?
Can you ask me what a repository is and how Git tracks changes?
